fields_of_interest: Energy, Environment, Research and innovation, Transport, Climate Action
head_office_address: c/o The Airport Operators Association 3 Birdcage Walk Westminster
eu_initiatives: Sustainable Aviation is interested in the development and implementation of EU policies on aviation and environment and how these are transposed into UK policy.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
relevant_communication:
Sustainable Aviation has developed a series of Road-Maps on CO2, noise and sustainable fuels.  These Road-Maps explore the opportunities to disconnect growth in UK aviation from any substantial increase in CO2 emissions and no increase in noise.  Realising these opportunities requires proactive public-private partnerships, especially in the development of sustainable aviation fuels, support for aerospace technology development and implementation of air traffic efficiency solutions. 
 
To read our Road-Maps and Progress Reports please see: 
http://www.sustainableaviation.co.uk/publications
goals__remit:
Launched in 2005, Sustainable Aviation brings together the main players from UK airlines, airports, manufacturers and air navigation service providers to set out a collective and long term strategy to ensure a sustainable future for UK aviation.  
 
SA has seven specific goals around which our work programme is managed.  These goals can be found on our website: 
http://www.sustainableaviation.co.uk/our-goals/
